pullRequest.body:
inserting an option into a game

---
This PR is split out of #14498. Here, we define the operation of inserting a left or right option into a game, and prove a few standard results about it.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks, and is labeled with `awaiting-review`.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [1e4fe08ef0](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14517/commits/1e4fe08ef0b0a380c0d6fe5bb0d1efb7c316e62b)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ insertLeft`
`+ insertLeft_equiv_of_lf`
`+ insertLeft_numeric`
`+ insertRight`
`+ insertRight_equiv_of_lf`
`+ insertRight_insertLeft`
`+ insertRight_le`
`+ insertRight_numeric`
`+ le_insertLeft`
`+ neg_insertLeft_neg`
`+ neg_insertRight_neg`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

I moved `insertLeft_numeric` and `insertRight_numeric` to a position after `Numeric.neg` so I could use `Numeric.neg` to write the proof of `insertRight_numeric` in terms of `insertLeft_numeric` (like @eric-wieser did for the other file)
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9924416951/job/27415703354)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9924416951/job/27415703449)

I think this is about as far as I can review this, as someone not that familiar in the area. The style and naming looks good now, thanks. I'll have a quick go at shortening the proofs, but probably someone else should give this the final review to check if any obvious lemmas are missing.

The naming convention would normally call this
```suggestion
lemma le_insertLeft (x : PGame) (x' : PGame) : x ≤ insertLeft x x' := by
```

I think the usual naming would be something more like
```suggestion
lemma equiv_insertLeft_of_lf {x x' : PGame} (h : x' ⧏ x) : x ≈ insertLeft x x' := by
```
Can you explain "gift horse" in this docstring, since it has not been mentioned before?

```suggestion
/-- The pregame constructed by inserting `x'` as a new left option into `x`. -/
```
since these are variable names, and this renders as markdown in vscode / the web docs. Same throughout your docstrings.
Flip conclusion and rename `insertLeft_equiv_of_lf`, and similarly below.

Name is wrong. Should be `insertLeft_numeric_of_numeric`, but just `insertLeft_numeric` is better. 

Similarly below.

```suggestion
/-- Inserting a smaller numeric left option into a numeric game results in a numeric game. -/
```
I added these two theorems, since they make the proofs much shorter below.

Any reason to not instead use
```suggestion
  | mk xl xr xL xR => mk (Option xl) xr (Option.rec x' xL) xR
```
or whatever the spelling is that works?
This nicely avoids having any useless `_ : Unit` variables floating around

I'm not sure about this. First, the proof of `insertLeft_numeric` seems to get a little more complicated, since `simp` doesn't seem to work very well with `Option` values and I have to do an additional layer of `constructor` / `rcases`. But also, perhaps more significantly, this wouldn't generalize to the case where we want to insert a whole family `xl' -> PGame`, in which case we definitely need a `xl ⊕ xl'`. I think we would want to do that later in the development of the theory.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(SetTheory/Game/PGame): inserting an option a game
